System A: Baseline + Qwen (placeholder): BM25 on PubMed with the original query; concatenate top-k abstracts; Qwen generates the final answer. No cross-encoder reranking.
System B: Placeholder: BM25 + simple rerank (specify the reranker and top-k kept) + your generation model. Note any guardrails or post-processing.
System C: BM25 on PubMed with Original + 3 reformulations; MedCPT Bi-Encoder (L2-norm) → Cross-Encoder reranks top-20; truncated docs appended to QA context.
System D: BM25 on PubMed (original query). From 200 retrieved, keep top-30 after rerank; MedCPT Bi-Encoder + Cross-Encoder reranks top-20; final QA context from selected docs.
System E: Placeholder: describe what’s unique (e.g., different retriever, more context, alternative LLM, constrained decoding).
